result.execSummary:
The defendant Beverly J Bartlett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Three days jail credit, only if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
No possession or consumption of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns.

No contact with Breanna Wilson (11/10/97).

Defendant must take all medications as prescribed by her treating physician. 
Medication use to be monitored by DOC and provide DOC the amount of pills needed/taken in a month.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: STAYED - defendant must provide medical update to the State and DOC every 3 months. If medical condition improves, defendant must report to jail. Court to make that decision upon information received from DOC on her medical condition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Beverly J Bartlett

records.addlTxt: for Furlough - APPROVED - consistent with the Sheriff's Rules and Regulations.

08:44 AM Defendant Beverly J Bartlett in court, in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Beverly J Bartlett appeared by video means. Other appearances include Jail Administrator Bradley and Sheriff Dennee. Court informs the defendant that her attorney was not able to proceed today as she did not have the medical report for the defendant. Bartlett is asking to be released due to her health conditions. Administrator Bradley responds, have made accomodations to be able to house the defendant, the Jail's Nurse Practitioner wishes the defendant to be released due to the defendant's medical condition, jail would at least like for the defendant to be allowed huber for stated reasons. Court gives brief overview of the case and the reason for the original sentencing. Discussion on both the original sentence and the defendant's declining health. State has no objections to adding huber to the JOC. Bartlett makes statement. Court will make a temporary order at this point allowing for her attorney to respond and investigate it further - will allow huber for the defendant for all of her medical appointments, will consider a further stay of the condition time if it receives additional information since the October doctor's report. Court explains it's ruling to the defendant. Adjourned at 9:07 AM.
Adjustment Number: 18A 001892, Payable Number: 40652, Receipt Number: 18R 003346, Amount: $20.00
from the court - Defendant shall begin her jail sentence on December 7th 2018 at 4 PM. Reporting to Forest County Jail.
for Use and Disclosure of Protected Health Information (PHI)
from court to all concerned parties that DE will not need to report to jail and continuing updates every 3 months

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Beverly J Bartlett in court with attorney James T. Runyon.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 8:35 AM. Called 15CF178 and 15CV85. State - resolved. Runyon provides court with plea questionnaire. State - plead G to #1 as alleged, #2 and #3 - DRI, joint recommendation of 3 years probation, $100 fine plus costs and surcharges, originally going to seek 1 year of conditional jail time but informs Court why the State will not be asking for that (health issues of the defendant), AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 200 hours of community service but left up to P&P, take all medications as precribed by her treating physician and no contact with Breanna Wilson (11/10/97). Runyon and Bartlett agree. State and Runyon do not have an agreement on the civil matter. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3. Bartlett pleads G to count #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Court states its concern in regards to the recommendation. Runyon makes final argument prior to sentencing and addresses the Court's concern - asking Court to follow joint recommendation. State makes correction on one of the co-defendant's sentence. Court asks for medical records of defendant to verify Runyon's statement. Bartlett makes statement, remorseful. Court reviews medical records provided by Runyon (8:58 AM). Record reflects that the Court has reviewed the provided medical reports. State makes additional comment in regards to defendant's statement. Defendant makes additional statement. Runyon asks Court that if it does order jail - that huber be allowed for stated reasons. Runyon - 3 days credit (stipulated). Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: $100.00 fine plus costs and surcharges totalling $748.50 - take bond posted - refund remainder to poster; AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 200 hours of community service, take all medications as prescribed by her treating physician and medication use it to be monitored by P&P and provide to P&P the amount of pills needed/taken in a month, 6 months in FC jail - stayed - provide a medical update to State and P&P every 3 months and if medical condition improves - report to jail but the Court to make that decision upon information received from P&P on her medical condition, no contact with Breanna Wilson (11/10/97), credit for 3 days only if revoked, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, no voting rights, no possession of firearms, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
from atty Runyon remove trial as client will enter plea and can set for PLEAS.
Jury trial on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Beverly J Bartlett in court with attorney James T. Runyon.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:14 PM. State - here for FPT - resolved but defense attorney has concern with time of sentencing for stated reasons. Runyon addresses the defendant's issue, asking for sentencing to be set in mid June. Court continues bond, sets for JT, if resolved ahead of time, contact the court as plea is due 48 hours ahead of scheduled JT.  Jury trial scheduled for June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on March 23, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Beverly J Bartlett in court with attorney James T. Runyon who appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:40 PM. Also called 15CV85. Court does notice of retainer by Attorney Runyon and dismisses Burns from the case. Court asks if the defendant will be accepting the State's offer. Runyon believes she will not be accepting it but needs to get all of the discovery from the State/Burns. Burns will get the discovery to Attorney Runyon upon his request via phone to her. Court continues bond and sets matter for another FPT. Burns will give discovery back to State and he can send it out. Runyon agrees.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Beverly J Bartlett in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:35 PM. Also called companion case, 15CF178 (State vs. Beverly Bartlett - who appears in person and with her counsel Mary Burns). State calls Breanna Wilson. Wilson sworn in at 2:36 PM. Court makes statement regarding use immunity for today and 5th amendment rights. Scholke has gone over 5th amendment rights with the witness and State agrees that she is granted use immunity today. Court goes thru 5th amendment and use immunity collaquey with the witness. Witness understands those rights. Counsel has nothing further to add to rights/collaquey. Direct exam by State at 2:38 PM. Burns objects - speculation - sustained (2:46 PM). Finlan stipulates to identification of his client for today's purposes (2:48 PM). Burns stipulates to identification of her client for today's purposes (2:50 PM). Burns objects - speculation - overruled (2:50 PM). Cross exam by Burns at 2:50 PM. State objects - sustained (2:52 PM). State objects - form of question - sustained (2:52 PM). No cross by Finlan. Wilson excused at 2:53 PM. State calls Sgt. Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 2:54 PM. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Burns at 3:04 PM. No cross by Finlan. Robinson excused. Burns makes statement regarding the return of items held at the jail. Finlan has nothing further. Court finds probable cause on each case, binds both defendants over for trial. State files Informations on both cases that mirrors complaints. Burns files Motion for Substitution of Judge. Court denies for stated reasons (consolidated case). Burns and Finlan have Informations, Burns and Finlan waive reading of it, Burns enters NG pleas on all counts for her client and Finlan enters NG pleas to all counts for his client. Court accepts NG pleas for both cases, continues bond for both cases, sets both cases for FPT. Burns makes comment regarding civil action filed against her client by State for civil forfeiture (15CV85). State and Court respond. State is lenient on time to file answer on civil matter. Burns and Finlan ask about personal items being held by FOSO to be released. State will confirm with FOSO regarding these items. State will make a decision on the phone within 10 days, other items can be returned to the owners. Finlan and Burns can make arrangements with the deputies for pick-up of states items. State - will be retaining the narcotics that have been seized. Court - FOSO to release Ms. Barlett's driver's license. Burns asks if the narcotics that are not part of the crime can be released to the defendant. State responds - needs claritication from her physician for stated reasons. Court - defendant needs to get something from the doctor for the return of the narcotics. Burns requesting FOSO to do an inventory of the pills being held. State and Court respond. Adjourned at 3:22 PM.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm. State to make arrangements ASAP for the release of the driver's license for Ms. Bartlett.. Court will sign an order if needed.

Defendant Beverly J Bartlett in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:01 AM. Burns has complaint but has not gone over it with the defendant, off record to go over the complaint with the defendant.  Back on record at 9:03 AM. Burns has gone over the complaint with the defendant, understands charges and penalties, waives reading, requests PH, asking for keys, car and prescription medications back. Court continues bond, sets for PH. Court hears request for the return of the car keys, the car and her medications. State responds - car is intended to be seized, not sure what is left with the medications but will return the ones seized from the home, State will return all keys except the ignition key, defendant instructed to contact Thomas Robinson tomorrow to get items back.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
